website_summaries.verdict: We like the use of non-stick ceramic plates, since they are PTFE and PFOA-free. Good capacity.
pros: Ceramic non-stick coating is an upgrade
Plates are removable and dishwasher safe
Includes panini press and floating hinge design
cons: Not a true five serving size
Grilling ridges are thin, making food slide too easily

customer_reviews.title: this product made me swtich to Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: I was a huge fan of GF grills. I have had one for ages. The newer ones are simply, sorry....garbage. The new surface takes forever to warm up and the temperature is too low. I love having adjustable temperature. I also like crisping things...something I did not find this one to do. I gave it away to someone who never had a GF grill as it'll likely be fine for them. I went with a vastly superior Cuisinart product that has adjustable heat, sear mode, etc...much larger and much better...
customer_reviews.author: Headless

customer_reviews.title: instructions say Green=Ready No timer or on and off switch which even my parents 10 year old George Foreman has Iv been disappoi
customer_reviews.text: Its okay, just barely. Bottom Tray is a lot hotter than top tray, the bottom half of your grilled sandwich will burn before the top is browning. The Panini press is too heavy so you will get some very flat sandwiches. Quality over all feels really Cheap but you do get what you pay for Quality Control Issues, Status lights on my unit installed backwards. Red=Ready, instructions say Green=Ready No timer or on and off switch which even my parents 10 year old George Foreman has Iv been disappointed in this Product. The 5 serving claim is absolutely ridiculous, you can fit two slices of bread side by side on the cooking grill that is it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: I love George Foreman grills
customer_reviews.text: I love George Foreman grills. I've owned 5 or 6 of them over the years. Sadly, as others have mentioned, the non-stick surface wears out long before the unit does. Why can't we just buy replacement plates? Anyway, I purchased this unit thinking the non-stick ceramic plates would last longer than the traditional non-stick plates that are typically found on George Foreman grills. Wrong! These ceramic plates began sticking badly after the 5th use? Take my advice and stick with the standard non-stick grills, not ceramic. They last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's great.
customer_reviews.text: We've had ours for a while now and it works really well. The Pro's are that it is a healthier way to cook meat, and I love that it is much easier to clean with the removable plates. The Con's (and they are not really Con's - more minor issues I would "tweak") are that while I like the variable temperature control, there's no indicator of what temp setting it's at. I just guess temperature based on common sense like the middle would be medium....hopefully. Also, while the size of the cook surface is usually sufficient, I wish it were a little bit larger for when I want to cook several items.
customer_reviews.author: Kim C

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk !!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using foreman grills since the beginning, almost,20 years ago. This would be my third iteration of the unit over that 20 year period and I can only warn you that they’ve ruined the product. The removable cook surfaces do not heat evenly, the top is much cooler than the bottom. The non-stick surface was ridiculously slippery for about a dozen uses, now I can’t even cook a hamburger without it tearing the top of the meat off when I open the lid. Even if I use nonstick spray, which was never necessary with previous versions, the grill still mangles the burger. Save your money, buy something else. I didn’t even get a year out of this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Reechpayne

customer_reviews.title: Try grill right away and check temperature
customer_reviews.text: Careful! Not sure if it's Amazon seller or what... but my grill only heats up to 200F - my last one was about 375-400. I accidentally waited too long to return. UGH I'm going to have to go to manufacturer now for warranty issue
customer_reviews.author: M. T-B

customer_reviews.title: Love it but is it safe?
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with how this cooks and how easy it is to clean. I was concerned though when I read that there was a warning from CA on the box saying that this item has some toxic chemicals in it. The ad had stated that the machine was free of the common toxins found in so many cooking pans and that is one reason I bought the machine. Now I have a machine that according to California contains other toxins. I've decided to use it anyway because I don't use it every day and because California tends to be very, maybe excessively, "green" I wish George Foreman would come out with a statement to address this situation.
customer_reviews.author: Bren

customer_reviews.title: Get the steaks ready.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this model. It's the second one I have bought. First one lasted years. This one updating to ceramic is a fantastic new update to the grill. As always the plates come off making it easy to clean. Only complaint is that the light system is a little wonkey. The red stays on the whole time the green comes on when ready the shuts off after as short time. I find this to be very stupid. Red should go off and green stay on. Over all I am please with my purchase and use the grill often.
customer_reviews.author: sciven2020

customer_reviews.title: My best Foreman grill yet
customer_reviews.text: Been a while since I had a Foreman grill because I don't use Teflon, the ceramic plates are great. They detach and clean up really easy, but first they cook a mean dish. I am totally happy with this grill, the only thing I disagree with is that it cooks for 5, they would have to be some pretty light eaters because I couldn't fit a whole chuck steak on the grill at once. But there's only one of me so this isn't a thing. I started to give it 4 stars for that deception but it wasn't worth a star. This little unit gets all 5 stars from me, definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Good, but the "Non-stick plates" aren't
customer_reviews.text: I loved the removable plates which made cleaning easier. However, the "non-stick" isn't. The bottom plate especially was hard to clean, and collected burnt on char. To make matters worse, no replacement plates are available. I just had to buy a new grill. Also, beware: these are a lot smaller than the old George Foreman grills. That was probably part of why I scorched the plate; it was too small to handle a family of four in one pass, so I had to keep grilling a lot longer than with a larger grill.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Lupton

customer_reviews.title: The light indicator is broken/ low quality standards
customer_reviews.text: Just received the unit today, was excited to grill some chicken/make a burger on this. I plugged it in and waited, and waited and waited for the damn light to change from red to green. After waiting 15 mins I touched it and it seemed hot but the light wasnt changing to green. I figured what the hell and put my chicken and burger on. It indeed cooked but the light is definitely broken as I tried several times to get the light to change green. Pretty disappointed by this.
customer_reviews.author: Jps101

customer_reviews.title: Can I give it 6 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Lazy to cook meat but having a little carnivorous boy I got this "mommy helper". And I am blaming it for 100% increase of meat consumption in our household!! Super easy to clean, which is the biggest + ... just unclick the top and bottom plate and wash like any plate [hand or dishwasher] ... very fast to heat up. Vertically small so easy to store. And the drip tray is separate which is brilliant for ease of manipulation and washing. And the rest is just up to your imagination [seasoned chicken breasts, hamburgers...]
customer_reviews.author: Lucie

customer_reviews.title: This Foreman Grill is severely flawed.
customer_reviews.text: By the second time I used this I noticed uneven cooking on the removable plates. I thought I could deal with that, but now grease pouring out the back. And as of recent , the non-stick grill plates make clean up horrible. I'm wondering what happened. Food is sticking and charred. I owned one before this and it had a few hick-ups, but this is ridiculous. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: chattykatty

customer_reviews.title: George Foreman is a culinary genious!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill! It's small enough for 1 person, just right for 2. The removable plates pop right into the dishwasher, so clean-up is easy-peasy. Sometimes you have to do a little scrubbing with a plastic scrub brush, mainly when cooking chicken. Coating the plates with a little olive oil helps reduce the stick. The plates are ceramic, so I don't recommend metal utensils. Over-all, I am pleased with this purchace.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: I friggin love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so it's not as large as you might think it is, it'll hold 2 butterflied chicken breasts or 2 half pound burgers comfortably. The detachable plates make this thing so easy to clean! Get the recommended brush for an extra $10. You'll make 2 passes an the plates will be spotless. Also, use oil for coating the plates, don't use spray. It can eat your plates coating. I cook with this a LOT. As a single guy, this is a no mess, no fuss, very versatile piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Insert Clever Name Here

customer_reviews.title: Not Non-Stick
customer_reviews.text: I assumed that this Foreman grill, like others I've owned before, would be non-stick. It is not. While it is not difficult to clean, I expected to be able to just wipe it clean, and that is definitely not the case. I also find it annoying that, again unlike other Foreman grills, the signal that the grill is heated is the green light going off. On the others I've owned, the light goes on when the grill is ready. Finally, I find the removable grills much much harder to put back on the my last one, where the grills just snapped on. These have a latch, which never seems to want to catch before the 3rd or 4th try.
customer_reviews.author: G. S. Reed

customer_reviews.title: It also seems like no matter how short of time the meat is ...
customer_reviews.text: This was ok at first. Nothing stuck to the plates, and cleanup was a breeze. Eventually that all changed. There is now a permanent brown discoloration in the middle of the bottom plate, and everything sticks. It also seems like no matter how short of time the meat is cooking, the plates blacken and burn where any part of the meat is touching. I'm not so sure the ceramic idea isn't just hype, and not enough is known about it especially when it comes to a heating surface that cant be controlled temperature wise. Does it break down over time with high heat? Not sure, but that is concerning. For that reason, we're pitching it and buying a different grill.
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: No grill marks on food.  Long time to pre-heat.
customer_reviews.text: I had a smaller GF grill but the non-stick came off within a few uses. Wanted to love this one but sadly, disappointed. Pros: Love the removable plates for cleaning. Cons: Less of a grill and more like a steamer? Can't get any grill marks on any foods. Yes, I even dried off the meat. Takes a very long time to heat and doesn't seem to get very hot. Says it's a 5 serving but can only get 2.5 burger patties or 2 chicken breasts at a time. Wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: George Foreman grill is a great cooking option when you can't grill outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Everyone has a george forman grill. These are highly adaptable and I use them for grilling all types of meat (I do have to spray/rub a bit of oil on fish to ensure non-stick) and root vegetables. I have lived in Las Vegas and Oregon, so being able to grill indoors is a big plus. I find these more convenient than grill pans for my stove. I like the removeable grill plates and the larger size. The build quality isn't as good as the originals though, but the price has come down to the point where you can easily replace one when something breaks. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: CookieMonster

customer_reviews.title: Grill plates won't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this item. The grill plates will not stay hooked in. It does not cook evenly. Takes almsot 25 minutes to heat up. This is my 4th George Foreman Grill since they have been on the market. If it had been my first I would never had brought the product again. Only enough room for 2 4 oz. hamburger patties. Forget steaks. Can only do 1 at a time. Pictures are misleading. Find another style besides this one because it is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is my second George Foreman grill the one I replace had seen better days. It was given to me and I used it for years it held up great it was time to lay it to rest. So I set out to find a replacement I ended up on this model because it comes apart for easier cleaning best improvement by the way. I can hand wash heat elements or pop them in the dishwasher either way I love this change. So far so good I hope this one lasts me year to come like the original grill.
customer_reviews.author: Namiko Howard

customer_reviews.title: Had been happy with a different George foreman grill for 10 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box and cleaned it as the instructions before use. Plugged it in to turn it on and found it cracks appearing in the ceramic service immediately. Turned it off, cooled it off, Packed it back up, and started the returns process. I will be selecting a different grill. Had been happy with a different George foreman grill for 10 years before this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: order a size larger
customer_reviews.text: like sleeping on a cloud, very comfortable, not too hot, not too cold. always had a problem with getting too hot at night but with this set I have not had a sleepless night. washed it, dried it on low, worked perfectly. its not super fluffy at first but puffs up. when you get a dark color comforter expect the stuffing to show a little here and there when you really look at it, the stuffing is white and the fabric is dark. great quality. also order a size bigger, I have a pillowtop queen and I ordered a king, fits just right.
customer_reviews.author: Lauryn M.

customer_reviews.title: I have used it several times now and wow it's so easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this is a TWO serving grill, not 5 (unless maybe its for 5 chicken tenders?). However, I didn't really need 5 servings and I read the reviews beforehand so I knew what I was getting. I have used it several times now and wow it's so easy to clean!! Most people I have talked to say they avoid using their old GF grills because they dread cleaning them, I was the same way. Now it's like, what can we cook on this?? Also as an added bonus it is ceramic instead of Teflon so it's not giving off cancer causing toxins. Loving this grill!
customer_reviews.author: dreamy885

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This George Foreman grill is the one to buy because its ceramic coated plates are far more durable than the black plates of the base model, and you can purchase replacements if necessary. The maker, Spectrum Brands, stands behind their products and provides excellent customer support service. Get this one, not the cheap base one. The only drawback is that there's no temperature control, but it grills awfully fast.
customer_reviews.author: Rainys A. Blekaitis

customer_reviews.title: Love the Ceramic Removable Plates!  Don't wash in dishwasher.
customer_reviews.text: Love the ceramic plates and the ability to remove the plates to wash! A huge improvement over the previous teflon grill which was a beast to clean. However, I was putting it in the dishwasher and after about 6 months it began to stick. I couldn't get the plates clean no matter what methods I tried from researching the internet. I bought another one, and the OXO Good Grips Electric Grill and Panini Press Brush.  This brush should be included with the grill. Along with electric switches:
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Ocean

customer_reviews.title: so I was happy to upgrade to a ceramic coating for more healthy ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had George Foreman Grills for years and have used them nearly every day, so I was happy to upgrade to a ceramic coating for more healthy cooking over the old non-stick surface. While the pictures are misleading about the depth of the grill and doesn't compare to my previous roughly square model, this worked well for about 2 months. Then it stopped heating enough to properly cook anything. I am very disappointed and would give it 1 star, if it weren't for my love of the previous versions. Unfortunately, this may force me to use frying pans again?!
customer_reviews.author: David Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this one because it says it will cook 5 servings, but I seriously can't see this grill cooking 5 servings at all. It is very narrow. It is about 13" long, which is nice, but it is only 6" wide, so cooking just one small steak on it, took up much room. There is no way I would be able to cook for 5 people on this grill. I had more room on the original George Foreman grill. I am so unhappy with it, I will be returning it, and buying the original size. It's less money, and there is more cooking room on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Cooks well! Cleans well!!;)
customer_reviews.text: I love, of course, the healthier cooking aspect of the George Foreman grill. This is my first experience with one and it was definitely worth the purchase! So far I've cooked hamburgers and chicken with the grill and everything has turned out PERFECTLY! The removable, dishwasher-safe grill plates were definitely a selling point for me too and they are AWESOME! I'm thinking about getting 2 more grills for my sons!:)
customer_reviews.author: RavenWitch

customer_reviews.title: grill problems.
customer_reviews.text: piece of junk,don't buy!almost impossible to clip the top grill in place and the top grill does not heat. you have to flip what you are cooking to cook both sides.i waited to long to return.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great counter-top grill
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older George Foreman grill without the removable trays, and I absolutely love it! My older grill was much larger than this one, but being a single person who lives alone it was far larger than I needed it to be for my purposes. Easy to clean, easy to set-up, and easy to use. This model has no temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Firman

customer_reviews.title: avoid this one
customer_reviews.text: I am a long time George Foreman Grill user/owner. Have probably had 5 over the years. I use mine almost every day. but last one started sticking so bad so changed to this one. " 5 servings" would have to be mini servings. actually was too small for 4 pieces of bacon. When I purchased I didn't realize no temp control. Turned my back and burned bacon. as much as I hate to say it, I am going to change brands.
customer_reviews.author: M. Quattlebaum

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Major flaws in design though
customer_reviews.text: The plates are hard to put in place, the cord is very short and I wish there was a temperature control. Over all this isn’t their best design. If you are considering buying this product either pick an older model or wait for the company to improve this model
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little Foreman grill
customer_reviews.text: There’s a couple of features missing on this one that my old one had. It doesn’t beep when it reaches cooking temp, and it doesn’t have a timer on it. It’s also smaller than my original one. This is great for cooking for 2-3 people, but we are a family of 5, so I have to cook in batches. Cooks well though and is very easy to clean. Do NOT use cooking spray on it. It will cause buildup and make foods stick.
customer_reviews.author: April Hale

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the white one, with non removable plates for 12 + years and it finally gave up! I ordered this one, and it fits just as much on it, and cleans up much easier. It has a couple of "hot spots", however, I am more than happy to work with that. I have done bacon and sausage on it and it is quick and painless cleanup. I did 2 filets last night for 6 minutes and they were delish! That would have been a double digit cost in a steakhouse.
customer_reviews.author: adrecord

customer_reviews.title: Meal prep life saver
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING. I habe started meal prepping and this bad boy is so freaking amazing. I will cook all my chicken breasts (11 pounds worth) in less than 30 minutes. Especially since I slice my chicken breasts in half. They stay nice and juicy but I can still get crispy edges ! I love that I can just shove it in the dishwasher too. The only downer is if food or sauce gets caught on the back causing it to drop a little bit. But other than that, best money spent.
customer_reviews.author: A.T91

customer_reviews.title: Great grill! Replacing with same model!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this model for 3 years and I am currently ordering a replacement of the same thing (plus the 4 year warranty). I love this grill in size and usefulness. The only reason I have to relplace is due to severe scratching on the surface due to my husband's improper cleaning, which led to food sticking to the surface.
customer_reviews.author: C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working right after return window closed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first month or so, but then just after the return window ended it started to smell like electrical burning every time you plugged it in. No idea how to to a replacement from the manufacturer. We've had a smaller Foreman grill for over 5 years with no issues. Guess they just don't make them like they used to. Not buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: EASY to clean!
customer_reviews.text: This grill takes up quite a bit of space, but it is soooo much easier to clean than the grills that don't have removable cooking plates on them. It would be nice if the temperature control showed you the heat setting. We replaced an OLD George Foreman grill that did not have removable plates with this one. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Temple

customer_reviews.title: Works, but non-stick ceramic coating is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: My last foreman grill lasted over ten years, and held up very well. However, this new foreman grill with the "non-stick cermaic coating" is struggling after six months. While the grill technically works, it now has stains from grilling all over the ceramic coating. It doesn't matter how hard I scrub, it won't come off. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: John ¥

customer_reviews.title: too small, description not advertised correctly
customer_reviews.text: 5 serving size is really about 2 servings size. I returned it right away and went to Wal-Mart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Workmanship - Defective out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these models for 12 years or more...thought it was time to do a replacement. New one arrived and I could instantly tell a difference in the workmanship/quality of the product. The new one seems like it's almost a toy. The top plate would not even lock into place. Again it's so cheaply made. My old one is like a tank. At this point I'll just keep using it and I guess not even consider replacing it. Really, really disappointed. I'm returning it for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brand

customer_reviews.title: So easy to clean!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had many Foreman grills and always found the clean up difficult. It is so easy now with the removable grill sections. For years, we have used a Foreman grill about 3 times a week. Wonderful way to grill steaks, hamburgers, fish, vegetables, esp. asparagus, etc. Can't imagine cooking without using the Foreman, but now so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha Banco

customer_reviews.title: Who are you feeding?
customer_reviews.text: This claimed to be a 5 serving grill. It will only hold 3 Food Lion pre-patted burger patties. Unless you plan on a half a burger per person, there is no way it will handle 5 servings. Same thing frozen marinated chicken breasts from sams.. 3 max... I have no idea how to feed 5 people without cooking a meal in shifts unless they are all toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: E C.

customer_reviews.title: This is sooo easy to clean up
customer_reviews.text: I just got this grill - had the small one before. This is sooo easy to clean up! I got the warehouse deal - box suppose to be dented but was not. It was in perfect condition. The only thing I have found is that with burgers - don't dare cook them as long as it says! It cooks so fast. I recommend this - it says for 5 servings - I would say a little shy of that but this is for my husband and me....so it is perfect. The family size would be too big. I love it!!!! Wish it had the option to lay flat when cooking veg so they wouldn't slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Quick Meals
customer_reviews.text: I've been eating fast food pretty much daily now for a year, I bought this over xmas and I've used it for the entire month of January. I've lost 15 lbs in a month. This grill heats up fast (within 3 minutes) and cooks any meat or veggie on both sides at the same time. It helps keep me off of fast food!
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Useless for sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk. Cannot be used for sandwiches or anything that is not solid. Sloped design slides top of sandwiches off the bottom and makes a mess.
customer_reviews.author: David Plokhooy

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleaning. No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the original grill many years ago and this by far is such an upgrade. It’s amazing that the grill plates can be removed for easy cleaning. Works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Jusburnin_dc5

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th George Foreman & I love it. It doesn't hold 4 or 5 servings of (store bought) burgers. But probably could hold that many if they're handmade. But that's not a big deal. Just keep grilling. I've grilled burgers ( turkey & beef), fish & chicken on this to perfection. Even made grilled cheese sandwiches. The cheese didn't stick. Love how the plates removed easily but wouldn't put in the dishwasher personally. Just wash them by hand people! I bought the foreman sponges to clean the grill. Only reason I didn't give a 5 was because of the serving size. But this is a 5 star grill.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz Roy

customer_reviews.title: No-stick, removable ceramic plates make cleaning easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model grill because of the ceramic plates. Food slips off without sticking and it is easy to hand-wash. I think the surface area is really only big enough for 4 chicken legs and thighs, not 5, though. I've had a George Foreman grill before and loved the cooking results. However, the previous model had some type of coating on the plates that over time peeled or dulled, and it became an "stick" surface instead of "no-stick."
customer_reviews.author: Mother of Twins

customer_reviews.title: I like the product but the one thing I have a ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but the one thing I have a problem with is the upper plate doesn't catch very well. It takes me a long time to finally get it to catch. The lower plate works very well and catches the way it should. The newer grill has a better surface now that cleans much better. My last one eventually made the meat stick and was harder to clean which is why I bought a new one which is much better. Perhaps the plates could be aligned better so they wouldn't be so hard to attach.
customer_reviews.author: hostess gal

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and defective
customer_reviews.text: We’re sending this back without ever using it. The ceramic plates would not attach to the grill, and the attachment brackets look so flimsy that we decided not to have the defective grill that we received replaced. Save your money. Buy a quality product instead of this flimsy contraption.
customer_reviews.author: L. Chatain

customer_reviews.title: Removable plates are the best
customer_reviews.text: By no means do I think this could hold 5 servings, but with that being said I still love this grill. It cooks quickly, I don't have to worry about flipping my food, and it's probably the easiest thing to clean in my kitchen. I've been using it to cook for one and meal prep for the week. I took a star off cause I hate how oil can drip behind the unit when you open it to remove food.
customer_reviews.author: Loribelle

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: The ceramic plates worked very well for a short time, however, though I used just a sponge to clean them, food soon started sticking and cleanup required a plastic scrubber. Though it lacks temperature control, I would say it is not needed (my past Foreman had it and I virtually never used it). For the price, this Foreman is exceptional; grilling made easy and making pressed sandwiches a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is great for salmon
customer_reviews.text: There were a couple of flaws in the workmanship and I was initially going to return it, but kept and have no regrets. It is great for salmon, boneless pork chops, burgers, certain cuts of steak and marinated vegetables. Just about any recipe for grilling and marinating can easily be found online, including the George Forman recipes. But for those who do not have this access, I think a basic recipe booklet should have been included because the timing is different than standard grilling.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Size matters!
customer_reviews.text: I like ceramic coating, but, it is SO small! 5 servings? It would fit 2 hamburger patties, what then...you split it up into 5 sections? I opened the package and put it right back into the box and am returning it. Obviously, I didn't pay attention to the size dimensions, yet I don't recall seeing dimensions of the cooking surface. Looking for another one that can really serve a family of five.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Lebby

customer_reviews.title: Not that big..  probably not the best design
customer_reviews.text: Not as big as I was thinking, can still only cook 2 hamburgers at a time. First foreman purchase. Not impressed with the fat tray. I don't like how it's not attached, completely loose. Also, when checking the food, if any fat is in the top, it rolls down the back to the counter...
customer_reviews.author: M. Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: I hate this purchase
customer_reviews.text: This made chicken taste rubbery, meat taste dry, and turkey meat smell disgusting. One of my biggest purchase regrets out there. The cleaning on it is really frustrating and it just did not make the food taste good. I heard this brand was good but from my experience this model is no good
customer_reviews.author: jbatman

customer_reviews.title: Much better than previous versions
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with my old Foreman grill. The coating was starting to come off, in spots, and it wasn't that easy to clean. The coating on the new one is completely different, and extremely easy to clean. Bravo! It does seem to cook a little hot, but I can work with that. Overall, I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Acur81

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I owned one of the old school George Foreman Grill and missed the convenience at times when needed. Compared to my old school one this grill appears to be flimsy and cheaply made. I can already tell it isn't going to last long. You would think they would of at least put a timer in it like the old school ones. Very disappointed in this product. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: aplastikplanet

customer_reviews.title: Search further!
customer_reviews.text: Parts Does not click in place. Should have returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Not as big as expected
customer_reviews.text: Did not give cooking area size other than 5 servings. 5 servings is an understatement. It is not big enough for 3 fair size hamburgers.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Meh....
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fan of this grill. Did not come with instructions as to what settings to use and my food comes out dry. Could be because I’m using the wrong setting but don’t know...cause there were no instructions. The only thing I have been successfully able to do is sandwiches but this is a lot of money for a glorified sandwich presser. On a good note, it’s early to clean since the plates come off but the thing is pretty big so storage may be a challenge if you don’t have much cabinet space or a pantry to stick it in when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best small appliance I have ever owned!! Will always have one! A+
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing in my kitchen!!! I love, love, love it! Fast cooking! Fast cleaning! I never loved a small appliance more than this item! I waited forever to buy one and wish I would have a long time ago. It's made my life so much easier! I will always have a George Foreman grill in my house forever! The seller was great as well! It arrived quickly and began cooking on it immediately and haven't used my stove or oven since! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Charlottekay

customer_reviews.title: Eat Healthier and cooking has never been so easy & quick!
customer_reviews.text: Because of the way it is sloped the grease and fat go right into the drip pan making your meats so much healthier to eat. I cook everything from steaks & hamburgers to sausage & bacon. It takes half the time as it would on the stove as you are cooking both sides of the meat at once. A medium rare steak can take as little as 3 minutes to cook. I've used George Foreman grills for over 10 years now and this is the best one I've purchased so far.
customer_reviews.author: CincyCheryl

customer_reviews.title: No frills, But who needs them?
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to use, no cheap buttons or sliding temperature controls to wear out. Does tend to steam rather than grill your food, But that does not really seem to be a issue. It does rid your food of grease. Rather shallow drip pan could be a little deeper. All works and does its job in a very simple fashion. That's the way I like it!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mamma

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking the whole meal.
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. I can cook meat & vegetables at the same time. It needs an automatic shut off/timer. I've overcooked several pieces of meat because I couldn't set a time to stop cooking or a timer bell to remind me to check what I am cooking. I would have given this a 5 star if this feature was included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Already on way back to Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Opened this to use it for the first time. It took 30 minutes to heat up and approximately 45 minutes to cook a boneless skinless chicken breast. I had a foreman that finally croaked after 12 years of use, absolutely loved it (GRP4A), and of course they don't make them anymore. May have to look at another brand......beyond disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Banes

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: It was way smaller than I thought. I eve. Drew out the measurements before purchasing and I thought I had an idea of the size but it’s on a slope and I could not see how 4 burgers would fit in it I’m giving it 4 stars do to the fact that I can’t speak about the function of it because I didn’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: The clean up is so easy!
customer_reviews.text: This grill was perfect ! Great for family cooking. Cleaning it was my favorite part. It was paper towel wipe down clean. It took me littereraly 30 seconds before the grill was ready to go for next use. I cooked 12 burgers 2 thick porkchops, bacon wraped asparagus, bacon wrapped stuffed jalepenos all in the first use. No flare ups no issues. The meat waas juicy and tasty! If i had to find something i didn't like about this grill id be hard pressed to do so. Fabulous product. We have bought much more expensive products that didn't deliver. This grill does.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pyle

customer_reviews.title: A great appliance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few years ago, and its still standing strong to this day. Easy to clean, cooks very well. Its a really good appliance to purchase. Very glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Chiyo-chan

customer_reviews.title: Great grill, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the old Forman grill I had, but has ceramic cooking plates. I read many reviews saying it’s hard to clean, but it is very easy. When your done cooking and unplug it, wipe it clean with a crumpled paper towel. 2 half sheets does the job perfectly. Best to do when grill is still warm.
customer_reviews.author: V.J.C

customer_reviews.title: Yummy , juicy burgers in 3.5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: We love this George Foreman. It's built for just two or one and we love making burgers and chicken on this. The burgers are so juicy and it's literally 3.5 minutes for thin burgers and maybe 4 minutes for thicker ones. I put a thin layer of cooking spray on top and bottom of the grill sheets. I also add a thin layer of onion slice on top, then spray that with cooking spray add a pinch of salt and you have a wonderful juicy burger with grilled onions on top. Also..no greasy clean up. Can't beat that
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Nero

customer_reviews.title: Not working as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in August and it quit working properly. It was hard to heat up and took too long. After I got it heated up the grill cooked alright for those few months and then wouldn't work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Rita K. Fieldman

customer_reviews.title: So Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: We love this Foreman Grill. In fact this grill is for our winter getaway in Mesa, AZ so the first one we bought and have enjoyed for years can stay in the kitchen of our main home and summer residence. We grill a lot and still use the outside propane grill for steaks and tenderloins. Where the Foreman comes in handy is burgers. So quick and easy, and just as good as those grilled on propane.
customer_reviews.author: KBL in ABQ

customer_reviews.title: Mighty cozy for five1
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not a five serving grill! You might get five sliders on it but, at most, three standard sized burgers, three sandwiches and two average size steaks. Not sure who gave the info but it ain't correct. It will have to wait a bit to be used but it does seem the grill plates are awfully light, especially compared to my old Foreman. I don't think I will be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Fine if you like every variety of meat, fish, and poultry cooked at the same temp
customer_reviews.text: Used it for chicken thighs, which was fine since I propped up the front so ALL the fat wouldn't drain off - but there is no temperature control. The other Forman grill I used had one and I loved it. It was also a hell of a lot sturdier than this one. I agree the top plate is difficult to get locked into place - it CAN be done but it's not easy. So all and all a lousy piece of equipment that I'd rather not keep . . . but I'm not sure how difficult returns are.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Davis

customer_reviews.title: burn hazard
customer_reviews.text: The heat surfaces do not attach easily in fact they seldom attach correctly. This causes a huge potential of getting burned. When the lid is lifted the heating surface falls out. I have tried and tried to get it connected. Doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great only for 1 year, and then it dies
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Jan 31, 2016. It broke (wouldn't heat), got refund feb 12, 2016, and now the refunded one broke again- no heat, no lights generate. We used this 1-2 times a week for turkey burgers and angus burgers. Disappointed in product quality and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: VA

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up so easily
customer_reviews.text: This grill is incredible. Great quality and easy to use. I have only cooked marinated chicken on it. After I took the chicken off, the grill looked like I was never going to get it clean. I just run it under hot water and lightly brushed it and everything just slid right off. REMEMBER to never use cooking spray. I ruined my first George Foreman Grill with cooking spray. The size is definitely not 5 serving. 3 maybe 4 depending on size. But, I'm giving it 5 stars anyway because everything else is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Alger

customer_reviews.title: We love this George foreman grill
customer_reviews.text: We had one that the plates did not remove so we returned it and got this one. The plates remove, the temperature is good, it’s our second one and we do love it. My husband makes chicken and it’s tender every time!!! Two skinless chicken breasts five or 5 1/2 minutes on each side. (he flips his I don’t know if other people do). Don’t spray the plates with oil it cooks better with out and they say it could ruin the surface. My husband prides himself on being able to cook dinner in 15 minutes between the microwave and the George Foreman grill even though we have a Gourmet kitchen!🤗
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Forgy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, just works!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW, I cook eggs, fish, (literally takes 1 hour to bake a fish in the oven and soo much work involved. This thing however, easy peasy, oil up your fish and lay it on this bad boy, 30 mins later its done and no work involved), potatoes, warm up left over indian bread and meats. Super great, it works and its HUGE!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good so far, I like it
customer_reviews.text: Bought April 12,2020. It is June 14th. This George Foreman has been working great. I use it almost every day. It's easy to clean . I had a George Foreman with black and copper plates. Those didn't last long before the color came off.
customer_reviews.author: shortcake

customer_reviews.title: I'd give it 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this grill. Removable plates make it easy to clean. Also, the temp control is genius! We've done chicken, fish, steaks, and chops on this so far and have been very impressed with the results. The fish was the best fish my hubby said he ever had. Chicken was moist, not dry like it usually is with other cooking methods. The steaks and chops were better on this than our propane grill. We have had this grill for 3 months now and look forward to many more uses!
customer_reviews.author: Amber C.

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: They say 5 serving, but I can't get 5 burgers on it. My burgers are usually 1/2 pound each. Might be able to get 5 quarter pounders on it. But I really like it. Limited counter space, so it fits in well. Glad we bought it. Would have bought locally but couldn't find this one around here.
customer_reviews.author: Coldwaterite

customer_reviews.title: Cooks even & thoroughly
customer_reviews.text: I just plugged it in and cooked. Cooked thoroughly and evenly. Cooks great. I do have One suggestion; Make the grease drip tray Wider. Had to empty the tray once and it was a mess. That’s all I’d do to make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: James Rush

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to clean and easy to remove the plates once you get the hang of it. The only problem that I had with this was no temperature control. Otherwise, this item would have five stars. I love using it to grill burgers, shrimp kabobs, chicken and grill fish. Any boneless meat works best for this grill. This is a perfect size for a two people. Size up for the larger grill for a family of four or more. LOVE THIS GRILL!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Rain

customer_reviews.title: George Forman
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! The removable trays are great! In my old one the trays couldn't come out, it was such a pain to clean. This new one is wonderful! The trays come out and go back in very easily. Makes clean up so nice! It's a good size too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice for preparing quick meals
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Just wish it had an on/off switch. Need to plug and unplug.
customer_reviews.author: lagRI

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean!  Gotta love that!
customer_reviews.text: I have a George Foreman that we use all the time. I heard about these with the removable grill plates and had to have one. I did as others recommended and plugged it in the first time outside. It had a smell but I didn't feel it was overwhelming (of course it may have been if inside). It Cooks great and is so easy to clean. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Beachlvr

customer_reviews.title: Would Not Heat Up!
customer_reviews.text: Would not heat up at all. Red light would come on and always stay on, but would never heat. Turns out a co-worker of mine ordered the exact model from Amazon a few weeks before me, and he had the exact same issue. Sounds like Quality Control issues to me.
customer_reviews.author: arby

customer_reviews.title: Cooks well but messy and slippery
customer_reviews.text: Cooks well but grease drips from the sides when you open it. Also slides all over.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cotts

customer_reviews.title: Love this grill
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I waited so long to replace my 20+ first George Foreman grill. This grill works great and is super easy to clean. My husband and I recently became empty nesters and this is a great tool now that we are cooking for only two.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Hall

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to clean ceramic.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I've ever made. The ceramic grill cleans with only an easy wipe. It is truly non stick. This makes cooking burgers so easy and they get done in half the time since both sides cook at same time. I love this grill. It's very easy to take apart to clean and probably the easiest to clean cooking item I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: J. M.

customer_reviews.title: New and Improved is Neither
customer_reviews.text: This is a poor representation of the original George Foreman grill. The cooking service is about 2/3 the size of the original. This unit takes 10 minutes longer to heat up than the original. There is no heat control like on the original. There are two settings ON and OFF. The clips holding the cooking plates in must have been designed b y Micky Mouse. They certainly were NOT designed by an engineer. Cumbersome and poorly designed are the code words for this "new" unit. Save your money or buy a better unit. This one is not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Wendi L. Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: ... had this unit for 7-8 months and it works great. Cooking surface is a bit small but big ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit for 7-8 months and it works great. Cooking surface is a bit small but big enough for two nice sized burgers or a big steak. Clean up is a breeze, just detach and wash in the sink. The ceramic plates have worked great, nothing sticks and again, cleans easily. I liked my original George Foreman but I really didn't need anything that big anymore and it was a hassle to clean at times...if you're cooking for one or two this is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I can't believe how easy it is to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I can't believe how easy it is to clean. Replaced the same size but without the removable plates. It doesn't seem to get as hot as the old one but also doesn't scorch top like the old unit. I just adjusted my time a little as you just have to experiment until you get it correct. I cook chicken breast and quarters about 30 to 35 minutes and they turn out great. I cook salmon or mahi-mahi about 8 to 10 minutes. Haven't tried steaks on this new one yet, but liked them on the old one, but not as well as on a regular grill.
customer_reviews.author: John Barker

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: For two people this is a superlative cooker. We have owned several Foreman grills (generally the larger sizes) over twenty years and all have lasted at least ten years. Most longer. We have retired them only after we have consumed the last shred of teflon coating. The new white ceramic removeable plates are spectacular in the way they cook and clean-up afterwards. Far better than the older black teflon. We look forward to many more years of Foreman grilling.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Got you one
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite pleased, I had stopped using my gf grill because it was such a pain to clean. The day this one came in I gave the old one away. This one is smaller but it's just 2 people at my house. It could cook for 3. The plates come out easily it's a snap to use and SO EASY TO CLEAN! Glad I bought it, it's an excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Jerrica

customer_reviews.title: Not really for 5 people.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy cooking on this grill,the only problem i found is its not really a five person grill.It works great for 2people i eat 2 1/3lb burgers the wife eats one thats about all i can fit on the grill.other then that im really happy with it.Easy clean up cooks fast .
customer_reviews.author: frank cohan

product_meta.title: George Foreman 5-Serving Removable Plate Grill and Panini Press, Platinum, GRP472P
product_meta.description:
Color:PlatinumLooking for fast and easy cleanup? We upgraded our removable grill plates with a durable, nonstick ceramic coating. It’s just one of the ways the George Foreman 5-Serving Removable Plate Grill and Panini speeds up the cooking process. Fast preheating, consistent grilling temperature, and dishwasher-safe grill plates, combine to give you tasty, easy-to-make meals in just minutes. Hey, what do you know—dinner’s ready now! 

*slope removes up to 42% of fat from 1/4lb. 80/20 ground chuck
*slope removes up to 42% of fat from 1/4lb. 80/20 ground chuck.Two Indicator Lights - The red power light lets you know when the grill is plugged in, and the green light shows when the grill is preheated and ready to cook up a tasty meal.
feature_bullets: 5 Servings - Feed the whole family in record time. With 72 square inches of grilling space, you can make five servings of everybody’s favorites all at the same time. The product does not have variable temperature control
Removable Plates - Easy cleanup is essential, and that’s what the removable grill plates are all about. Pop them in the dishwasher after grilling and they’ll be ready to go for your next meal
Premium Ceramic Coating - Time for an upgrade! Ceramic is the key to our improved nonstick coating. It’s 5x more durable, stain- and fade-resistant, and free of PTFE and PFOA

Fat-Removing Slope - It’s the sure sign of a George Foreman Grill. The sloped grilling surface helps remove up to 42% of fat from meats for lean, tasty meals. Removable Grill Plates - The top and bottom grill plates are completely removable, and cool-touch plastic grips make them easy to handle
Drip Tray - The dishwasher-safe drip tray collects excess fat and grease so you don’t have to. How nice is that.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,944 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
